metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15683 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 81 and Firefox ESR 78.3. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.4, Firefox < 82, and Thunderbird <78.4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15683` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
